metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10903 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in python-cryptography versions between >=1.9.0 and <2.3. The finalize_with_tag API did not enforce a minimum tag length. If a user did not validate the input length prior to passing it to finalize_with_tag an attacker could craft an invalid payload with a shortened tag (e.g. 1 byte) such that they would have a 1 in 256 chance of passing the MAC check. GCM tag forgeries can cause key leakage.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.2
python3-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> following what debian says, our xenial version is not affected.

criterions.comment: python-cryptography package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-1ubuntu1.2').
